snippet: Requests for a list of cases that a retired detective, Louis Scarcella, testified in are rejected by the district attorney.
abstract: Jim Dwyer About New York column examines refusal of Brooklyn District Attorney Charles J Hynes to release list of murder cases involving some 50 convictions in the 1980s and 1990s, in which former Brooklyn Detective Louis Scarcella played part; says law does not require release of list, but holds that at stake is how Hynes is managing tricky business of honorably reviewing what may be mistakes made by his own office.
lead_paragraph: Requests for a list of cases that a retired detective, Louis Scarcella, testified in are rejected by the district attorney.

headline.main: The Cost of Withholding Information as Brooklyn Murder Cases Are Reviewed
headline.print_headline: The Cost of Withholding Information as Brooklyn Murder Cases Are Reviewed
